TopicTitle: I can't believe its been a year already

Articles.Content:
It only seems like yesterday when I downloaded 0.18 and went to work building deathtraps that I called rockets.

Thank you Squad, for the best year of entertainment I have ever experienced
Same here bro...... Where did all the time go?.......

I feel bad for joining so late (0.20).

But hey, these have been an awesome 5 months!
From when 0.13.3 was released to now, i enjoyed KSP all the way

I've been here since .16! It's like a completely different game now...

Remember when everyone begged for Career Mode, docking, planets, etc? And now, it's all here!

Where'd January go? Lol

I wish ksp could live forever

I feel bad for joining so late (0.20).

But hey, these have been an awesome 5 months!

Don't feel too bad, I only joined a month or so after 0.21 was released.
it'll be two months from now that a year has passed since i bought ksp and it gets even better

Joined sometime shortly after the second demo was released (.17 i believe), think i saw an article in PC Gamer. Downloaded the demo, was only really 5 minutes into it when i launched my first rocket and frantically modified it each time to fix things i was doing wrong. I loved the learning process! bout 15 minutes in i decided to buy it but it took a bit longer before i could bring myself to stop playing long enough to buy and download the full version. During this time i was also making some friends aware of the game they now HAD to buy.

How long have others lasted with the demo before having to buy?
I started playing KSP around .17 and i totally agree.

How long have others lasted with the demo before having to buy?

I got the demo when the full version was at 0.21 - and it was only 3-4 days before buying.

I got KSP on November 30th, 2012. That's when 0.18 was released; no wonder my download was so slow

It's been a great year!

Wait what?

I have been playing KSP since march?

O_O

I didn't bother with demo at all I've just watched a couple of clips on YT, seen Kerbol rising over surface of Kerbin and decided to buy the game. That was money spent well. And couple of days later 0.18 hit - with docking, new graphics and other goodies. Good times
This is all I can think after reading the title of this thread...

Can't remember exactly when I started playing KSP. Found it on a youtube channel I used to watch Euro Truck Sim on. Didn't even bother with the demo. Stem had it on sale for $7, so I picked it up. IIRC it was .19 or maybe early .20. Somewhere around 500 hours played, and still enjoying it.
Time?! What are you doing?! Time, stahp!
